phrases.text: À ơi ơ Ngó lên Hòn Kẽm Đá Dừng

culturalContext.description: This phrase features "hò" - work song - sung while laboring (rowing, farming, etc.). The exclamatory form adds emotional emphasis, common in Vietnamese folk music to engage listeners. Lullabies sung by mothers across all regions of Vietnam.
facts: Each region has distinct lullaby styles with local characteristics
Often express mothers' hopes, worries, and love for children
Vietnamese folk songs preserve oral traditions passed down through generations without written notation
Dan Tranh (16-string zither) arrangements of folk songs are relatively modern adaptations of vocal traditions
culturalContext.musicalContext: This exclamatory phrase contains 9 syllables, longer than typical, allowing for extended melodic development. As an exclamatory phrase, it likely features sustained notes or ascending contours for emotional expression. Soft, repetitive melodies with gentle rocking rhythm.
